title: LG tipped for Nexus duties as Google visits Korean HQ | Trusted Reviews
description:
![LG Logo](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**Rumours that Google has tapped up LG to build a new Nexus device have
resurfaced in the Korean media.**

According to
[eToday](http://www.etoday.co.kr/news/section/newsview.php?idxno=1093016) (via
[GforGames](http://www.gforgames.com/gadgets/new-lg-made-nexus-
smartphone-46670/)), Google engineers visited LG’s headquarters in South Korea
on March 16.

The report claims the engineers are still there, and plan to visit LG’s
various subsidiaries, including LG Innotek and LG Display.

There’s no saying for sure that such a visit would indicate LG’s involvement
with Nexus, and the visit could be little more than hearsay anyway.

Importantly though, this news follows on from earlier reports that suggested
LG would be [one of two
manufacturers](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/report-huawei-and-lg-to-
build-two-google-nexus-devices-this-year) working on this year’s Nexus device
line-up – the other OEM being Huawei.

It’s still not clear which manufacturer will produce the smartphone and which
will produce the tablet, however.

**Related:** [Best Android Smartphones
2015](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best-android-phones-1_round-up)

Recent rumours suggested that Huawei [would be handling the
smartphone](https://www.trustedreviews.com/news/google-s-next-nexus-to-use-
huawei-chip-not-snapdragon), which would land as the Chinese company’s first
Nexus device.

That would leave LG manufacturing the tablet, which would also be a new
venture for the firm, having never produced a Nexus tablet.

LG has worked on Nexus devices before, however, having produced both the
[Nexus 4](https://www.trustedreviews.com/google-nexus-4-review) and [Nexus
5](https://www.trustedreviews.com/google-nexus-5-review) smartphones.

Motorola and HTC made the most recent devices, specifically the [Nexus 6
smartphone](https://www.trustedreviews.com/nexus-6-review) and [Nexus 9
tablet](https://www.trustedreviews.com/nexus-9-review). Both were met with
lukewarm critical reception.

LG’s Nexus smartphones however, were very well received, so perhaps Google is
eyeing up the firm to make a new smartphone and restore consumer faith in the
Nexus line.
